page.title: 08Nordley Post Office & Stores
page.content:
The{stores}have been here since{1935. Supplies are obtained weekly from a {'Cash & Carry'}in{Wolverhampton.}The shop is open from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except Sunday.
There are{scales}for{weighing}and a {refrigerator}for{cold}foods.{Eggs}are delivered from Broseley,{bread}three times a week and the{milkman}delivers daily.
The{postman}visits daily at 9.15 a.m. and 3.15 p.m. to collect mail from the post box outside.The mail is taken to {Bridgnorth}and{Wolverhampton}to be sorted.The Post Office sells stamps, Postal Orders, Television licences and gives pensions.There are about{forty customers a{day}from up to{six miles away.
